com.dsi.ant.plugins.antplus.pcc
Class AntPlusControlsPcc

java.lang.Object
  com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc
      com.dsi.ant.plugins.antplus.pcc.AntPlusControlsPcc

public class AntPlusControlsPcc
extends com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc

Enables communication between a client and the Controls plugin service.

Nested Class Summary
static class AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioDeviceCapabilities
          Represents the capabilities of an audio device
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioDeviceState
          Defines codes for the audio device state, used in the updateAudioStatus command
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioRepeatState
          Defines codes for the audio repeat state, used in the updateAudioStatus command
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioShuffleState
          Defines codes for the audio shuffle state, used in the updateAudioStatus command
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioVideoCommandNumber
          Defines command numbers to use for Audio and Video control.
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.CommandStatus
          Defines status codes for use with the updateGenericCommandStatus, updateAudioCommandStatus and updateVideoCommandStatus commands
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.GenericCommandNumber
          Defines command numbers to use for generic control.
static interface AntPlusControlsPcc.IAudioCommandReceiver
          Receiver for the AudioCommand event, which is: Commands sent by a remote control to initiate an action on an audio device.
static interface AntPlusControlsPcc.IGenericCommandReceiver
          Receiver for the GenericCommand event, which is: Generic commands received from a remote control device.
 class AntPlusControlsPcc.IpcDefines
          Defines the keys and values used to communicate between the PCC and plugin.

          Receiver for the VideoCommand event, which is: Commands sent by a remote control to initiate an action on a video device.

          Represents the capabilities of a video device

Method Detail

requestAccessAudioMode

public static void requestAccessAudioMode(Context bindToContext,
                                          com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<AntPlusControlsPcc> resultReceiver,
                                          com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver,
                                          AntPlusControlsPcc.IAudioCommandReceiver audioCommandReceiver,
                                          AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioDeviceCapabilities capabilities,
                                          int channelDeviceId)
Send a request to access the plugin to receive audio commands and gain control of audio status updates. Only one client is allowed access to this mode at a time.

Parameters:
bindToContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request. Possible returns include:
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatSUCCESS
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatDEVICEALREADYINUSE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatUSERCANCELLED
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatCHANNELNOTAVAILABLE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatOTHERFAILURE
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, if successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.
audioCommandReceiver - Receiver to receive audio events
capabilities - An instance of AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioDeviceCapabilities used to indicate the capabilities of the audio device (e.g., support for custom shuffle or repeat mode). Capabilities cannot be changed after initialization.
channelDeviceId - Two-byte device number in the ANT channel ID to use when opening the controls channel. This number is used for pairing with remotes and should be as unique as possible. Set to zero to let the plugin generate the device ID (RECOMMENDED) based on the ANDROID_ID. This number cannot be changed after initialization.

requestAccessGenericMode

public static void requestAccessGenericMode(Context bindToContext,
                                            com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<AntPlusControlsPcc> resultReceiver,
                                            com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver,
                                            AntPlusControlsPcc.IGenericCommandReceiver genericCommandReceiver,
                                            int channelDeviceId)
Send a request to access the plugin to receive generic commands (e.g. lap, menu navigation). Only one client is allowed access to this mode at a time.

Parameters:
bindToContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request. Possible returns include:
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatSUCCESS
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatDEVICEALREADYINUSE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatUSERCANCELLED
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatCHANNELNOTAVAILABLE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatOTHERFAILURE
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, if successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.
genericCommandReceiver - Receiver to receive events
channelDeviceId - Two-byte device number in the ANT channel ID to use when opening the controls channel. This number is used for pairing with remotes and should be as unique as possible. Set to zero to let the plugin generate the device ID (RECOMMENDED) based on the ANDROID_ID. This number cannot be changed after initialization.

requestAccessVideoMode

public static void requestAccessVideoMode(Context bindToContext,
                                          com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<AntPlusControlsPcc> resultReceiver,
                                          com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver,
                                          AntPlusControlsPcc.IVideoCommandReceiver videoCommandReceiver,
                                          AntPlusControlsPcc.VideoDeviceCapabilities capabilities,
                                          int channelDeviceId)
Send a request to access the plugin to receive video commands and gain control of video status updates. Only one client is allowed access to this mode at a time.

Parameters:
bindToContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request. Possible returns include:
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatSUCCESS
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatDEVICEALREADYINUSE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatUSERCANCELLED
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatCHANNELNOTAVAILABLE
  • AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatOTHERFAILURE
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, if successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.
videoCommandReceiver - Receiver to receive events
capabilities - An instance of AntPlusControlsPcc.VideoDeviceCapabilities used to indicate the capabilities of the video device (e.g., support for recorder or playback). Capabilities cannot be changed after initialization.
channelDeviceId - Two-byte device number in the ANT channel ID to use when opening the controls channel. This number is used for pairing with remotes and should be as unique as possible. Set to zero to let the plugin generate the device ID (RECOMMENDED) based on the ANDROID_ID. This number cannot be changed after initialization.

updateAudioStatus

public void updateAudioStatus(int volume,
                              int totalTrackTime,
                              int currentTrackTime,
                              int audioState,
                              int repeatState,
                              int shuffleState)
Update the status of the audio device

Parameters:
volume - Current volume setting, given as a percentage.
totalTrackTime - Total time of the current track, in seconds
currentTrackTime - Current number of seconds into the current track
audioState - Current AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioDeviceState of the music player
repeatState - Current AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioRepeatState of the music player
shuffleState - Current AntPlusControlsPcc.AudioShuffleState of the music player

updateVideoStatus

public void updateVideoStatus(int volume,
                              boolean muted,
                              int timeRemaining,
                              int timeProgressed,
                              int videoState)
Update the status of the video device

Parameters:
volume - Current volume setting, given as a percentage.
muted - True if the audio is muted; false otherwise
timeRemaining - Time remaining on the video clip on a playback device, or time remaining available for recording on a recoding device. In seconds.
timeProgressed - Current number of seconds into playback/recording.
videoState - Current AntPlusControlsPcc.VideoDeviceState of the video device
